On 7/26/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
>
>
> Could =
you give an example when you think that reading/writing directly
> to/from =
a File is better than a stream.
>
> Also, when you have your array of Strin=
gs or single big string, what
> do you typically do with it? I can think of=
 some things but I am
> curious.


It's convenient when you want to do line=
-oriented filtering (e.g. regexp,
parsing logs, etc...).  You can always us=
e a BufferedReader + readLine(),
but it's still more tedious to write than =
just having an String[] returned
from a public method.

It's admittedly not=
 as effective memory-wise, but when you're dealing with
text files that are=
 in the tens of k's, it doesn't really matter.
